result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lindsy Mason Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Lindsy Mason Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Jon Josephsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defense requests a plea hearing be scheduled.  Case adjourned to Br. 16. Defendant to be produced for next hearing date. Plea hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Lindsy Mason Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Lindsy Mason Jr.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense had not received discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference for September 6, 2022 at 9:00 am, via zoom.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lindsy Mason in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Lindsy Mason in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Lindsy Mason appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #16CF1429. Sworn for the State: Officer T. Kotnik. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Lindsy Mason not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request STATE V-LEE hearing, Court Denied request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
The Judge's explanation is outlined on the submitted order.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lindsy Mason in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Lindsy Mason in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lindsy Mason appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
